page.title: 16Life in Bubwith
page.content: We asked a number of old people in Bubwith how the village had changed since World War II. These are some of the things they mentioned. There are fewer shops so people have to travel further to buy the things they need. However there is poorer public transport since the railway was closed in 1953. Other changes include the building of a new school and more houses. We think advantages of living in Bubwith are that there is less traffic, so it is quieter than a town. There are also more places to go for walks in the country. Disadvantages are that there are not so many shops so people have to travel a long way to get clothes etc. There are also fewer jobs for people.
